column2: I never guess. It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data.&x22
Some of the best theorizing comes after collecting data because then you become aware of another reality.&x22
War is ninety percent information.&x22
A point of view can be a dangerous luxury when substituted for insight and understanding.&x22
In God we trust, all others must bring data.&x22
He uses statistics as a drunken man uses lamp posts – for support rather than for illumination.&x22
Data! Data! Data! I can’t make bricks without clay!&x22
Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.&x22
If you torture the data long enough, it will confess.&x22
The alchemists in their search for gold discovered many other things of greater value.&x22
Once we know something, we find it hard to imagine what it was like not to know it.&x22
If you can’t explain it simply, you don’t understand it well enough.&x22
The goal is to turn data into information, and information into insight.&x22
Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.&x22
No generalizing beyond the data, no theory. No theory, no insight. And if no insight, why do research.&x22
The purpose of models is not to fit the data but to sharpen the questions.&x22
Here and elsewhere we shall not obtain the best insight into things until we actually see them growing from the beginning.&x22
With too little data, you won’t be able to make any conclusions that you trust.  With loads of data you will find relationships that aren’t real.&x22
When we have all data online it will be great for humanity. It is a prerequisite to solving many problems that humankind faces.&x22
For every two degrees the temperature goes up, check-ins at ice cream shops go up by 2%.&x22
Data is the new science. Big data holds the answers.&x22
If we have data, let’s look at data. If all we have are opinions, let’s go with mine.&x22
